attributes.action: Do not leave the EU based on an unsound referendum. Do not trigger Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
* Boris Johnson among others introduced the idea that we should vote leave in order to secure a better deal for the UK, not to actually leave. 

* The referendum was used to vent frustration at the government. Campaigns were set up on social media to encourage people to vote 'leave' in order to sack David Cameron.

* The leave campaign was built around the idea of spending 350 million pounds a week on the NHS instead of Europe. The morning after the vote when it was described as a “mistake”.
attributes.background: It would be irresponsible to trigger Article 50 and leave the EU based on a referendum in which 1.9% (fewer than 1 in 50 people) changing their mind would change the result. Given that people report that they voted 'leave' to send a message, not with a genuine desire to leave, the result is unsound.
